meanings.definition: To provide with a margin or border.
meanings.sent1: She carefully marginated the paper with colorful borders.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to marginate the painting with a thin black line.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to marginate its bed with all its toys.
meanings.sent4: The garden marginated the house, creating a beautiful frame.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to marginate their essays for a neat presentation.

meanings.sent1: The hiker marginated the cliff cautiously.
meanings.sent2: The boat started to marginate the shore as the storm approached.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel marginated the edge of the tree before jumping.
meanings.sent4: The car marginated the curb, almost hitting the stop sign.
meanings.sent5: The child marginated the pool, hesitant to jump in.
